summary:
Visual Artist, Lecturer and Art Advisor with a unique multidisciplinary portfolio. With over 20 years experience developing visual art projects in collaboration with cultural institutions as; The Mondriaan Fund, Prince Claus Fund, The Frederick R. Weisman Art Foundation, Rush Philanthropic Arts Foundation, The State of L3, Atelier GF Workstation, OLAA, VSB Fonds and the Danish Arts Council; as well as in the development of curatorial projects for institutions such as BOZAR Centre for Fine Arts - Brussels.

Graduated in 2006 as BA of Fine Arts, at the Gerrit Rietveld Academie Amsterdam. A Master of Communication Sciences at the Isthmus University, Panama and did an exchange program in Design and Applied Arts at Pratt Institute New York.

Visual Arts portfolio: http://www.aguzman.com

education.degree_name: Master Class, Race, Ethnicity and Postcolonial Studies

projects.title: N/N Studio Noisy Networks
projects.description: Noisy Networks is a global communication design and consultancy firm founded in Amsterdam by Antonio Jose Guzman. The studio develops innovative multidisciplinary communication design projects for numerous clients internationally.

authors.headline: writer/curator/editor of books on Marcel Pinas, René Tosari, Torzo Martha, Remy Jungerman/Nan Hoover/Bakelite

publications.name: The Day we Surrender to the Air

profile_positions.description:
The Prix de Rome is the oldest and most generous award in the Netherlands for visual artists and architects. The award dates back to 1808 when Louis Napoleon introduced the Prix de Rome in the Netherlands to promote the arts. 

The jury members for 2021 are: Ann Demeester (director, Frans Hals Museum, Haarlem), Amira Gad (head of programs, LAS Light Art Space, Berlin), Antonio Jose Guzman (visual artist, researcher, lecturer), Samuel Leuenberger (director, SALTS, Basel) and Viviane Sassen (photographer, winner of the 2007 Prix de Rome in Visual Arts). Chair is Eelco van der Lingen (director Mondriaan Fund). 

The new competition for the Prix de Rome, begins on 5 January, 2021. The Prix de Rome is organized and financed by the Mondriaan Fund.
profile_positions.title: Jury

profile_positions.description: "We evaluate an application as carefully, professionally and impartially as possible. That is why we work with independent consultants. These are experts, such as artists, exhibition makers, critics, art historians, museum staff and others who can value the development of visual arts and cultural heritage. to estimate. Guidelines and criteria apply to the assessment that objectify the personal views of advisors. In addition to quality, the most important criterion, testing is also done on presentation, development, recognition, professional and public reach. The assessment is made in mutual consultation between the advisers, who are asked to be generous and look beyond their own preferences. " Mondriaan Fund
profile_positions.title: Visual Arts and Heritage Advisor

profile_positions.description:
Atelier GF Workstation was founded by Antonio Jose Guzman in 1995 as a communication design, film and photography firm. Since 2005 the studio concentrate in the development of visual arts innovative multidisciplinary collaborative projects with numerous organisations and institutions internationally. Working in collaboration with a global network of visionary artists. We envision interdisciplinary spaces and audio visual projects exploring the role of the arts in postcolonial cultural politics and researching on hybridising identities. 

The studio is a firebrand deciphering about issues of race and power, reinventing and re-contextualizing modernism as a critical tool in the understanding of cultural studies. Since the studio was founded, we have created a series of self initiated projects, some of which have become influential in both sides of the atlantic.

Atelier GF Workstation projects has been exhibited worldwide at BOZAR - Centre for Fine Arts Brussels, the IDFA Amsterdam International Documentary Festival, Thessaloniki Film Festival, The Museum of Contemporary Art MHKA Antwerp and Corridor Gallery, New York City. The Atelier participated in the Sharjah Biennial, United Arab Emirates, Havana Biennial, Central American Biennial, the Dakar Biennial and the Panama Biennial.

Latests Projects: 

Supreme Exodus Lab Minerva Art Academy & The Frank Mohr Institute for Graduate Studies and Research in the Arts and Emerging Media - Hanze University Groningen, The Netherlands.

Curatorial coordination of Latin American Cartographies Bozar Brussels: The exhibition provides a unique perspective of the contribution that the arts make in countering and responding to the current rapid and disorderly urban growth in Latin America.  A transcultural artistic crossover project between Latin America and Europe, developed by Interarts and BOZAR and funded by the European Commission.
profile_positions.title: Founder

profile_positions.description:
Antonio José Guzman is Artist in Residence 2018 at Minerva Art Academy. Students worked together with artist Antonio Jose Guzman to create an exuberant collection of costumes, masques and head pieces. Inspired by the ongoing project of Guzman on migration, DNA and origin, the students make costumes of the most diverse materials. The exterior of matrasses – symbolic for the items migrants take with them across the border-, folded paper, dolls and flags. In addition, fifty m2 textile is screenprinted to use in the costumes. In addition to the presentation in the Koepelzaal, the costumes will be worn in a procession during the Biennial of Havana in April 2019. 

The Supreme Exodus LAB
The project is part of The Supreme Exodus, an ongoing project in which Guzman is inspired by the recent history of migration in Latin-America. Artist Antonio José Guzman constructed his monumental project from images of migration and demonstrations in Latin-America and the graphic image of his own DNA. He examines views on socio-cultural identity and migration problems. His installations can be seen as a data visualization of a continuous investigation into displacement and exile in Latin-America and the rest of the world.

Artist in Residence 2018
Each year in 2017, 2018 and 2019, Minerva Art Academy invites a different international top artist (Fine Art or Design) to work as an Artist in Residence. The AIR-project takes place at some of the workshops, for example metal or electronics, as part of the study programme. A learning and inquisitive working environment arises through the link with the artist in residence. Students and the AIR work together in an intensive research in which physical experiments are conducted. These experiments lead to a joint result and can be the starting point for new research.
profile_positions.title: Professor Of Art

profile_positions.description:
BEAR - ArtEZ Bachelor Experiment Art & Research: The course of study concentrate on specialisations in film and audiovisual artistic disciplines such as photography, feature film, documentary and experimental film, camera, directing, scriptwriting, animation, video, media design, media scenography, sound, sculpture, and public art. The study is supplemented by theoretical seminars and lectures, on the aesthetics and history of the arts and media.

ArtEZ University of the Arts: The academy distinguishes itself through the highly applied nature of its education. However, in Arnhem as well, art is undeniably the breeding ground of all our educational programmes. Art, design and practice are all common themes. The Arnhem educational model is characterised by a solid, subject-based curriculum that offers students a strong foothold and few shortcuts. Hard work and intense demands on both the artistic and craftsmanship of the work are the keys to success.
profile_positions.title: Professor Of Art

profile_positions.description:
Founder and creative director of The State of L3 Collective, a transatlantic diasporic group of visual artists, poets, writers, academics, performers and filmmakers who work together researching connections between Africa, The Caribbean and Latin America.

The State of L3 ® is an international network of artists blending different artistic media and disciplines. As an artist collective The State of L3 is an initiative that is the result of a network of different artists working together internationally through the following of a shared ideology and aesthetics.

The State of L3 plays a significant roll in the artists practice, because of the collective increased intelligence made possible by the cross combination of multiple creative minds and disciplines and also because of the networking capacities involved with the project. The name of the collective was inspired by the African L3 human DNA haplogroup.

Partners: VSB Fonds, Mondriaan Fonds, Prince Claus Fund , Erfgoed Nederland, Galleri Image, Aarhuus Stiftstidendes Fond, Kunstrådet / Danish Arts Council.
profile_positions.title: Creative Director
